attributes.title: What is the essence of your life?
attributes.description:
In today’s (07th October, 2015) Nithya Satsang, Paramahamsa Nithyananda expands deeper into the 14th verse of Isavasya Upanishad. The essence of which is - What are you worshiping in your life? He elaborates that -  “What you think as your goal, as the essence of your life, which you are moving in your life, you are worshipping THAT.” We first need to find out what are we worshipping. Second, how much is consciousness and how much is materialist, perishable. Find out how much is imperishable and how much is perishable. What is imperishable, what is the perishable that you are worshiping in you? Ultimately it is the imperishable, undying component of you, which is the strength, the bone structure of the cosmic law.
Today's subject of Vakyartha Sadas, spiritual explorations on the truth is: “How much is perishable in you. How much is imperishable in you.”
